intro: Sida carpinifolia f. balbisiana, commonly known as Balbisian cotton or Balbisian hibiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, cotton-like seeds enclosed in a capsule, which is a distinctive feature of the genus Sida. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural areas.
